creditline: Gift of David Tausig Frank and Kazukuni Sugiyama
description: paper carton is wrapped in brown paper; wooden box with inscriptions inside; fabric is light green/grey; image of tree branches in black ink with inscription in LL corner
inscription:
? {?}
(Plum blossoms mirror the white clouds of daybreak/ The bright moon hangs silent in the spring sky/ All corners of the world are filled with its light/ Fragrance flows into to the darkest places/ The mountain greenery stands reflected in the clear waters/ All I can do is to gaze.
The moon knows:/ this fragrance is flower-borne a truth passed down
from ancient times. Such a mystery/ difficult to explain in words. 

[Poem 2]
I have brushed these poems apart, yet they are more beautiful to me than even the lovely pond beside my house.)
signed: %%%%A spring day in 1936, poem and painting by Kodojin.
title: Old Plum
